modules.description: Provides functions to parse unified diff formats, extract change information, and generate structured representations of code differences. Works with strings, file paths, and custom diff data types that encode line-level modifications. Used to integrate visual diff rendering in code review tools and version control interfaces.

Provides functions to compute and format differences between two files or strings, returning a list of `diff` records. It includes operations to convert differences to strings with optional line number offsets, print results to a channel, and parse differences from input sources. Supports generating diffs from file paths, strings, or existing diff data, with error handling for invalid inputs.

Processes and tokenizes Odiff input streams, handling line tracking and lexical analysis. Operates on lexing buffers and custom token types defined by Odiff_parser. Used to parse structured diff data from text sources.

Parses input streams into a sequence of tokens using a provided lexer function, then processes these tokens into a structured diffs representation. It works with lexing buffers and a custom token type defined within the module. This is used to convert raw diff data into an abstract format suitable for further processing or analysis.

Provides operations to represent and manipulate file differences using indexed ranges and structured change records. Works with index ranges, diff records detailing additions, deletions, and modifications, and lists of such diffs. Used to track line-level changes in text files for version control or merge tools.
